alert.note: Alert for Eastern Walsh County; Pembina (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 4:17AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Marshall, southwestern Kittson, northeastern Walsh and southeastern Pembina Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 416 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Herrick, or 10 miles northeast of Grafton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Herrick around 420 AM CDT. Drayton and Robbin around 425 AM CDT. Bowesmont around 430 AM CDT. Mattson around 435 AM CDT. Kennedy, Donaldson and Hallock around 445 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include American Crystal Sugar. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 180 and 195. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
